author: siddd26
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

If a programmer is using Windows Powershell for any reason, he or she should not get strain in their eyes because of the colour themes used.

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Changing the colour theme of Windows Powershell as to reduce eye strain.

comments.author: siddd26
comments.body: Using colours that are soothing for eyes and give happy signals to human brain will help programmers to work for longer hours.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
> Using colours that are soothing for eyes

You can set look and feel (and partly behavior) of PowerShell with `$PSStyle`, `Set-PSReadlineOption`, `$profile` and cmdlets custom output formatting.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @siddd26 you specifically mention Windows PowerShell, but this repo is for PowerShell 7.  The terminal controls color themes and not usually the shell (outside of user customizations as noted above).

comments.author: ankit-akash
comments.body:
> @siddd26 you specifically mention Windows PowerShell, but this repo is for PowerShell 7. The terminal controls color themes and not usually the shell (outside of user customizations as noted above).
There are over 15 colors available.
To change the colour with script in *Powershell*  use: $Host.UI.RawUI.ForegroundColor = "Yellow"  or "red" or "blue" etc.
